website_summaries.verdict: The best premium bench top drill press with a long travel distance for deeper drilling.
pros: Spindle travels a full 3" with a single rotation of the control handles
Platform can be raised or lowered along the support tube for different materials and objects
cons: Built-in laser can be difficult to see when using the drill press on a mobile bench outside

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly POS
customer_reviews.text: I've contacted Wen a couple of times trying to resolve the excessive runout (wobble) on my Wen drillpress (4214). They sent me an arbor replacement that didn't help. Then I took a closer look at the chuck. Very poor quality and loose construction. I emailed Wen for a replacement chuck and the reply was a link to a $260 heavy duty industrial chuck which was about what I paid for this machine. Now my problem is finding a replacement not knowing the taper specs for the arbor. This Wen product should only be used for rough work where there is no expectation of accuracy or quality. Anyone have a suggestion or information on finding a reasonably priced chuck?
customer_reviews.author: Eric Williams

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this press. The laser is off over a quarter inch. The Chuck is properly seated, yet has fallen out twice (damaging a master grade guitar body in the process) the brake is a joke. Going from 3200 RPM to 2800RPM with the brake fully engaged. It will stop without warning on occasion and I’ve seen smoke roll out of it on multiple occasions. I own several WEN products. Most I would recommend, but stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Felts

customer_reviews.title: Came with a dangerous electrical problem
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for assembly were decent. Seemed like it was well put together until I turned the drill press on and it immediately tripped my breaker. I opened the top and made sure the belt wasn’t hung up and everything rotated freely. Read through the instructions again to verify I didn’t forget anything. Tried again with the cover open and this time I saw the arc flash before the breaker tripped again. I inspected the wiring and found a break that was arcing to the casing. I’m lucky they grounded the case properly. Im in the process of returning it and I’m hesitant to buy another Wen product ever again. Get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Bad table crank mechanism out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get past mounting the base to my workbench and attaching the column. The crank mechanism that raises and lowers the worktable jammed at a height of 5 inches above the base. Over the 5 inches it would move it was very jerky. I was not impressed with the quality of this mechanism and didn't bother to unpack the drill head. I decided to return it to Amazon for a refund rather than see if a replacement would be any better. I am researching more expensive units.
customer_reviews.author: sophie48

customer_reviews.title: No power (large bits) / Speed adjustment doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this a better score but I just can’t. I know you get what you pay for but this has some serious flaws. I am unable to really slow down the speed. No matter how much I move the speed lever I’m still well over 1500rpms. Going with larger bits? This can’t handle my 2” forstner. May just have to bite the bullet and spend the money on something better.
customer_reviews.author: JB123

customer_reviews.title: Defective production
customer_reviews.text: The base has one foot 1/16 lower than the rest. Ordered replacement and the same thing. Talked to tech support and they know about it and that it’s happened frequently. It seems to be a factory defect in a certain assembly line product output. Since this seems to have excellent reviews I presumed Amazon received a pallet of flawed product. Even if you shimmy it up it will be hard to keep from vibration with a motor running 3000rpm. I would suspect that a piece of one base broke off in a cast where others where subsequently made over it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat D

customer_reviews.title: WEN doesn't understand precision.
customer_reviews.text: During the past month I used this to drill a hundred holes for a new bookshelf. The chuck falls out frequently damaging the wood and requiring adjustments. The lasers are cute but imprecise and cannot be adjusted. The vertical adjustment for the wood base is not calibrated so you must estimate or re-measure its position. I did not call customer service because others have mentioned that WEN doesn't have customer service.
customer_reviews.author: David Robinson

customer_reviews.title: 1 day life span
customer_reviews.text: This drill press worked great for the first few hours and Then-the spring assisted handle mechanism broke. First day and first job and it broke. The only issue is the spring in the cap on left side. The lip on the spring snapped. It says heavy duty but heavy duty last more then 1 day!! Not happy and it is too big to return so I will get the spring replaced. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: base was warped on both orders
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. The drill itself looked to be pretty good, solid build and so forth. I was expecting some minor imperfections – after all its in the lower price spectrum – but I can't live with a wobbly warped base. So I sent it back and ordered another one. Just arrived today, took it out of box, and that base was warped also. I stopped there and decided I'll just pay more for a brand that can actually machine a decent base. Also the support lock handle did not adequately tighten (I saw one customer addressed this issue by adding a washer).
customer_reviews.author: T&W

customer_reviews.title: Nice shop drill press
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great table top press for the price. I added a keyless chuck and am now very happy with my purchase. On the plus side: - very stable and quiet - sufficient power for larger bits in hard wood and metal - with a bit of effort I got runout of about 4/1000" - laser and light are nice features - variable speed control is very convenient. I removed one star because: - I wish the speed range would go a bit lower - Occasionally, the motor hunts a bit for speed when turning on (might be the switch) - The depth limit is accurate but a bit tedious to adjust - No spindle lock
customer_reviews.author: B. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: WEN 12-Inch Drill Press
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great drill press. The motor is strong and I can adjust the RPMs on the fly. I had a chance to play with with the Jet JWDP-12 12'' Drill Press at Rockler and I loved it. I found this on Amazon and it is identical for about half the price. Cast iron table and base, very sturdy and durable. Paid around $250.00 for it and I am very pleased so for. I highly recommend this drill press.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brock

customer_reviews.title: more sturdy, continuous speed adjustments with digital readout
customer_reviews.text: I had the smaller WEN, the 10" version, 24" high. I could not get the runout to a usable level, bought a larger, higher quality chuck, cleaned and re-installed the spindle, etc. It drove me nuts trying to drill with any precision. Hence this drill press. This is a very different machine: more sturdy, continuous speed adjustments with digital readout, laser crosshairs, led table light, etc. Still have a tiny bit of wobble but it's within tolerances for what I do. Assembly was painless and all parts fit. You can even read the instructions! For roughly $185 it's a wonderful tool and vastly better than the smallest one they make.
customer_reviews.author: Novasystems

customer_reviews.title: Motor Burned Up After 10 Minutes of Light Use
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this drill press. It's HEAVY DUTY, and seems well-made. LED lamp and laser guide are excellent. The 5/8" chuck us really nice. It even drilled about 25 small holes in plastic and soft steel without any problems. Then after 10 minutes of use, the motor wouldn't turn on again. It just hums and does nothing. The pulleys in the access compartment spin freely. I've never owned a tool that burned up THAT FAST! Amazon replaced the drill press - I Heart Amazon. I'm Weary of WEN - who knows if / when my replacement will fail :-(
customer_reviews.author: B. Petrofsky

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. One minor problem is that if set at lower rpm it occasionally will just hum when started. I have always been able to start it by turning it off and rotating the Chuck a little bit and restarting it. Greater than a thousand rpm it starts much more reliably. I might have to replace a capacitor in the future. I have used it to drill mortises for wood with up to 2" forstner bits, it works just fine. And I have drilled 1/2" holes in 1/8" steel square tube and plate, cuts through it like butter. I am very happy with the press. Nice fit and finish easy to use table. Extension wing is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding drill press, great buy, totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: What a buy! I was looking at the Jet equivalent and couldn’t see a difference other then price. I know sometimes you get what you pay for but in this case I got more savings with all the features I needed and then some. It was very easy to assemble and made from cast iron. I cannot believe how easy it is to make adjustments on the fly for speed and see the readout. Whether I’m drilling wood or metal it’s easy to adjust for. It was delivered very quickly and again I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Of all the tools I have purchased on Amazon, this is the finest!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are a wimp, you can put it together yourself. I mounted it on a workbench, stood on the bench and put the head on myself! I am 78! It is heavy though. The instructions are very clear and easy to follow! All parts function as they say they will. For accuracy it would be nice to have a solid 1/2" rod to true the table but I made a drill bit work. This is a much nicer drill press than I have ever had, and I have spent a lot of hours in a machine shop!
customer_reviews.author: Bill L.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press for the money
customer_reviews.text: Funny how certain brands make really great models with good pricing of certain machines but not so much across the board. I like Ricon bandsaws and belt sanders but their 12 inch drill press isn't any better than this Wen model, which sells for a lot less money. I don't use the laser much on this Wen because I always seem to need to calibrate it but the rest of the features are great. I did replace the chuck with this one:  Easier to change bits and seems to have less wobble than the original Wen chuck.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome home shop drill press.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drill press because I needed a good , solid drill press that would do some heavy duty drilling in wood and metal , be fairly accurate , and would hold the bites steady. This drill press does all that and more. It is a very solid well made press that is very reasonably priced. It's very easy to assemble and has many features that other drill presses in this price range don't have such as the variable speeds , drilling depth , centering laser light , and of course the power to do the job. I highly recommend this drill press to anyone looking for a great tool at an even greater price.
customer_reviews.author: actech80

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years of use......
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for 2 years now and use it mostly for wood work but do a reasonable amount of metal also. For me, power has never been an issue as some claim. I use larger forstner bits in hardwood and it powers through with no problem, have cut up to 4" holes with no slow down. Love this thing. I just broke the depth gage collar and have sent an email asking tech support for a replacement cost, so will see if the customer support is good!!! Had a few issues getting hold of customer service but once I did the service was incredible and the part is on its way
customer_reviews.author: bpierce

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent machine. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a pretty decent machine. I come from using lathes and mills. I am happy with it. But I did buy a vise that was more expensive than the press. I took one star off because it lacks power. If you spin a 3/4 drill bit in like 3/16 plate and pull down on it too hard with a good sharp bit. The motor goes into like an over load protection and stops until the load on the machine is reduced. I can deal with that. But I sure wish that sucker would just eat! Likely saves hands and fingers since its likely to stop the motor before slinging a part around into your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Super buy for the $
customer_reviews.text: I love the 3"+ movement for a small bench drill press. LED target and LED lighting are great! Best WEN product I have ever bought and the best entry level drill press I have seen. Built in tachometer speed sensor is cute and OK, but not really needed. I have had lathes, mills and other tools in the $10K to $20K area. This certainly is not in that venue, but if you want a great bench press that will handle most anything for the hobbyist or home handyman, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Schings

customer_reviews.title: Recommended drill press
customer_reviews.text: This drill press deserve 5 stars but I giving only 4 bause chuck is bad. Chuck has 0.0035" runout and it is maybe good for only big drill bits. It is not unusual to buy new drill press with chuck that has big runout (typical chinese quality). But spindle runout is good 0.0002". Perpendicularity and parallelism of the machine is less then 0.1deg. Laser target mark is for orientation only because it changes position based on distance from laser and material you are drilling (but it is adjustable). Speed indicator is always ON. Variable speed works good and machine is not loud. I would recommend this product even if you have to replace chuck.
customer_reviews.author: Branko Bem

customer_reviews.title: Decent drill press for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little drill press that will serve well for most non precision jobs. It has enough power for anything you'll likely do with a small press like this. The table movement and locking system is smooth and easy to use, the speed adjustment is good and offers a wide variety of speeds, even the light is moderately useful. The only real problem with it is that it has a small to medium amount of runout but considering the price I think that's acceptable. It won't be replacing my big press anytime soon but it is very useable and for the price it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Model 4214. Chuck holds very small drill bits (#70)
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is used for wood and metal work. The speed range for my normal use is 900 - 1500 rpm's. There are times a slow speed is needed for larger drill bits. The speed range selector, the smooth operation of the chuck, a nice table and the many small features make this a great value. This happens to be my fourth product from WEN. The previous products work well and acted as ambassadors in my decision for this purchase, after reviewing other drill presses. I've many years working with milling machines, metal lathes, drill presses and many types of machining equipment. For home use, I feel this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Clete

customer_reviews.title: Customer service, WEN
customer_reviews.text: Four phone calls, three lost calls. Last one ok. The Laser does not work. Steve (CS) said new lasers would be mailed to me. Which I have to install. Getting the table squared on the press a problem. 1/4 " play, left and right. 1st the holding clamp was not installed correctly, from the factory. This solved the problem. Now raising and lowering the table is very hard to move. Steve said O' you have to loosen the clamp each time you want to raise or lower the table. HUH!!!! Makes no sense to me. Think maybe I should return the unit and order a new one. But then what will I then have to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been wanting one for a while and for this price I don't think you can beat this unit. Easy to assemble and nice quality for the price. I installed a JT33 chuck and I recommend it. NO key required. The laser came about 3mm off of bore tip. It comes greased and is well packaged. I like it. This will serve all my needs for the foreseeable future. I like the digital RPM readout.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Stable heavy duty benchtop drill press
customer_reviews.text: This almost 90 pound drill press is a workhorse for my small shop needs. Mine is locked down on a heavy mobile cart to roll where it is needed. With the attachable table ( WEN DPA2412T) the user can accurately locate and repeat holes. That table is wide enough to securely attach a variety of jigs that serve a multitude of tasks. There is no spindle lock but the depth stop can be used to lock in a depth setting for milling slots or rabbets. For my purposes in a hobby shop it is a wonderfully useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: John HenryTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: In the right circumstances, having a drill press is an absolute joy. This drill press is an inexpensive, light-duty tool that nonetheless has all of the basic features you need to drill accurate holes in a variety of materials. The assembly instructions are good, and I had no problems. Please note that this thing is *heavy*, so be careful. Also, it doesn't come with a full floor stand. I think this is actually an advantage. You can mount it on a shop bench or build your own stand.
customer_reviews.author: GearHead

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Total junk.
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is an absolute waste of money. I bought for hobby work and it is not accurate enough for that. Poor quality, poor finish and very under powered. The variable speed adjustment constantly sticks and the entire drill rattles. Don’t waste your time calling the company because when you can get an answer they say it is normal. Total junk. I plan to loose money and sell it and buy a drill worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Teri McCleary

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this press in part to cut holes in pine and pvc board. It works great cutting holes up to about 2.5" in diameter. It comes to a dead stop when using a 4" hole saw no matter how slowly you try to cut. I expected more from WEN. My hand held battery powered DeWalt does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: BaazAl

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for woodworking shop.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for my woodworking shop. For the price I don't believe you can beat it. There have been some complaints in other reviews regarding excessive wobble. My press has very very little. The work light is a great addition to the tool as well as the laser. I also really like the speed adjustment handle rather than moving belts -- very nice. Seems to be very sturdy construction. It took me about 25 minutes to unpack and clean the parts. I assembled it myself without help. Assembly time was 20 minutes. In summary I'm very happy with the purchase and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ranie

customer_reviews.title: Like the speed control
customer_reviews.text: Bought this press mainly to drill metal. Knew I would have to drill step holes for larger bits. That's why I paid more for for the variable speed drive. The led light is fine and like the speed indicator. I have drilled a few holes in metal and its done okay. It should last for years if you understand its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese drill press
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is the perfect example of cheap Chinese tools not worth the money spent on it. It fell apart first day locking lever on table stripped out and had to use a c clamp to hold it in place to use it I first tried to drill 1/4 mild steel with a stepped bit and it drilled in fine then just stopped bit in place stalling out from lack of power pretty weak drill press It also vibrates alot which the spindle handles loosened up guess I needed lock tight on handle Over all I boxes it up and returned it bought a fox shop drill press still cheap cost and far better quality
customer_reviews.author: russ taylor

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to check that pulley shafts are properly lubricated and quill has spindle stabilized.
customer_reviews.text: This press is a good value. Had to run it in and lubricate shafts with anti seize and adjust quill to quieten it down. The lid over pullies rattles as you adjust speed. Put a dab of silicone in each corner and let it sit to act as damper. No rattle. Run out on stock chuck is about .0025. This is not bad but I am OCD about run out. Put higher cost keyless chuck on and run out is .001. I would recommend this press for the cost as it is great for home shop for Wood Aluminm and steel drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Drill Press
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this drill press a short while but, so far it is much better than I expected. The size is perfect for my use and has run perfectly smooth and quiet for the several times I have used it. I love everything about this press. It was recommended that I have a helper to get the head lifted and aligned to the upright staff, but I had no helper and managed it all by 86 year old self. It took a while figuring out my approach but it worked perfectly the first time. I can't say enough about all of the great things this press has and does.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wengler

customer_reviews.title: Solid Press for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Well package. Just assembled today which was extremely simple. Seems like an accurate drill press. Tested with 2 inch augers but in pine went through like butter. The speed adjust is so simple and easy to do. Seems like the press runs smoother at lower or high rpms. Rumbles some in the middle. Two gripes: 1. The on off switch is flimsy and somewhat loose right out of the box. We shall see if it holds up. 2. The laser only works from a distance so the item to be drilled must be lowered 5 or so inches for the laser to line up. Not a big deal I didn't buy it for the laser.
customer_reviews.author: Adam probst

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Electric cover broken.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty small issue and you would think there would be a better way to address this issue. than write a less than going review. I just unboxed my new Wen 4214 Drill press and found that the small plastic cover for the junction box between the motor and the electric power cord was broken. This item probably costs about $1.50, but I have to address this issue before I use my new drill press therefore I can't comment on anything else about this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Fields

customer_reviews.title: Runout makes it unusable...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a $225 paper weight. Seriously regret buying it. There is so much run out in the spindle its unusable. Worked with tech support. They sent multiple replacement parts but still terrible run out. Run don't hide from this peice of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Not enough torque!
customer_reviews.text: I hoped for more but got less from this guy! The motor doesn't have enough torque to drill with Fostner or hole saw bits. It is an ok light duty drill press for sanding and drilling anything smaller than 1”. I have operated many drill presses and this is the first one that my hand held battery operated drills out perform. As always amazing was great with handling returns but I did get to talk to a Wren tech support to confirm it wasn't user error. After explaining I wasn't an idiot he finally admitted this unit wouldn't do what I needed it to do. He was nice just insulted my intelligence a few times.
customer_reviews.author: JeffreyS

customer_reviews.title: Can’t believe how good this is for $
customer_reviews.text: Is it a $1,000 Grizzly? Nope, but for the $ I’m genuinely shocked how good this is. Set up took 20 minutes including attaching to bench. Chuck and plate alignment was bang on out of the box. I’m mostly drilling into wood so did I measure to .0005 “? No but my drill bit lined up perfectly with my 6” square. Laser which I hate on most tools was about .5mm out. Won’t be using it so who cares. Built in light is friggin great though.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hendey

customer_reviews.title: Considerable pulley slip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the larger chuck and supposed higher powered motor. Unfortunately there is considerable slip in the variable speed drive (motor) pulley. So much so that I cannot use any bit larger than 1/2 inch for wood (a Forstner stops). No adjustments are available. My only option is a stronger pulley spring, some shim washers, or I might convert to a simple stepped pulley speed control system. These variable drive systems are notorious for slipping, and I should have known better.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: After risking a coronary getting the box in the house (heavy!!), the individual sections which were well packed, were easy enough to handle and assemble. The table was square without needing any adjustment, the "x" laser was also spot on without adjustment. It operates as expected and if I had to point out any deficiencies, it would be that the table is hard to stop rotating L-R by using the pinch-lock on the back. You really need to dog down on it. I ended up drilling & tapping two 1/4-20 holes to add "anti-rotation locking screws" on the upper yoke. Other than that, it's a great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Don Thomaso

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill press. Very well built and has some great features. The light and laser are a big help illuminating the piece and getting the drill bit lined up. The ability to adjust the speed by moving a lever on the fly is a huge plus! I'd absolutely recommend this drill press to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Big Fan of WEN Machines
customer_reviews.text: This was my first WEN machine. I was blown away by its quality, at any price. When evaluated against its price, it seems incredible. After this I bought two more WEN machines: their 6x48 combo belt/disc sander and their 8" grinder. All three are amazing values. I notice that all three WEN products I bought score in the 80+ % range on 5-star and 4-star ratings. Considering that some people won't give five stars to anything, that's a really high rating average. And I agree with the ratings. I highly recommend WEN products.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press
customer_reviews.text: Not a toy. Excellent 12 inch drill press for the price. Well built with lots of features at half the price of the rest. Unpacking was logical as was assembly. No issues at all. Run out is acceptable. Great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: Big upgrade on power and flexibility from the 10"
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the Wen 10" to the 12" drill press and for the most part I'm very pleased. I am surprised at the difference in power in the two. The negatives so far are: The Chuck isn't nearly as smooth as on the 10". The height tension is a bear to tighten. I'm a pretty strong guy and I need to really muscle it down to get it secure. I imagine that many folks will struggle with it. The depth stop wanders when the drill is on no matter how much I tighten it. (This alone had me consider returning it.) The pros: Dramatic increase in power. The speed adjustment is super easy. Digital readout is handy for ballpark speed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been terrific. I am pleased with the quality of the parts, the assembly of the machine, and would certainly highly recommend it. I have other drill presses, but wanted a table top model with quick speed control just for doing metal fabrication. The only thing I wish is that the table could be squared in both directions. Its rotation can be adjusted, but not the other axis. Mine is ever so slightly off, but I am really being nit picky about it... I'm sure I'll come up with a work around, but even knowing that I wouldn't hesitate in buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Rost

customer_reviews.title: Base wobbly, but overall a fairly good bench drill press
customer_reviews.text: Consider this to be a fairly good bench drill press. It replaced my 6 year old Ryobi bench drill press which broke down. Doesn't bog down with varied loads or speeds and the adjustment stops are easy to attain. My only complaint is that the base wobbled on a flat surface. There's no adjusting for that other than to shim up a corner and not liking that idea, I therefore switched the base from my original Ryobi, since the components are largely the same and problem fixed.
customer_reviews.author: strubstr

customer_reviews.title: A Beast of a Machine!
customer_reviews.text: The WEN 4214 drill press is a beast! It is very well made, and makes holes effortlessly. The laser is accurate, and the light is helpful. It is advertised as a bench-top machine, but I suggest finding a permanent home for it because it’s to heavy to move to and from your workbench when needed. I built a dedicated drill press table for it (see attached photos). If you’re interested in making the table, you can find the plans on woodsmithplans.com; search for wall-mounted drill press table.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and finish.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Very easy to assemble. Well made. Lot of cast iron. The laser was spot on, no adjustment needed. This has to be one of the best buys on the market. For $259 it has features of a much more expensive machine. There was no runout on the chuck. It was dead on. I don't know how they do it, but if you're in the market for a drill press consider this one. It can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Really Liking It!!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see there is a big difference between this one and my old one. Loving the variable speed control that you can use on the fly without having to change bands. Like the light and laser that comes with it and the motor size that it comes with really can drill through wood and metal with no problem and of course if you have a good bit. So far I am more than satisfied with purchase and it is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Serpico

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My first drill press, thus first drill press review. One of the easiest assembles I have ever had (except that one time I bought a hammer :-) ) .Took less than 30 minutes. Way better than the 5 hour band saw assembly. I love the speed control, done with moving belt manually. Table is a bit wobbly at times, stays flat, but rotates on shaft too easily. Accurate for my woodworker use, not means to confirm if it is too inaccurate or not.
customer_reviews.author: Plimtuna

customer_reviews.title: Fit the chuck correctly and this thing will rock
customer_reviews.text: Only a few things to add to other reviews. When assembling, if you follow the instructions of hitting the chuck with a rubber mallet or a piece of wood, your results will vary. After tapping the chuck in place, place a piece of MDF on the table and press the chuck down against it to complete the seating. Runs absolutely perfect and quiet. Also, the RPM screen DOES turn off when not in use while still plugged in. I cant think of any negatives at this point but I’m sure over time there will be a few.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Supertramp

customer_reviews.title: Check Everything
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in great shape. There was nothing broke, scratched, nor generally messed up. The only issue I had was that I had to tap out the table roller tightening knobs underneath the table. (8Mx1.25) Make sure to check all screws and nuts/bolts for tightness as some loosen up during shipping. The unit started up fine and everything seems to work. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in transit
customer_reviews.text: The drill press actually still works fine, but the plastic box on the back of the motor was actually damaged in transit. The screw hole was half broken off. I was able to remove the broken part and still get enough of a hold to screw the cover on securely, so no real problems as such. But disappointing on a brand new item. Still the drill itself works well and little vibration etc, so I'm reasonably happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Good power.  Chuck runout is significant, but, dies not affect wood work precision.
customer_reviews.text: Good power. Easy set-up and assembly. Laser spot on as shipped. Work light included is weak. Table is solid but not readily tightened. Most obvious issue is chuck run-out. This unit is exclusively used for wood working, so, whatever the run-out, the holes drilled have a circumferences that is spot on. One's results may differ if using this unit to mill metal.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality varispeed drill press
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill press because For drilling accuracy and repeated drilling with an xy vise. The unit performs well and the variable speed was a must. Who wants to change belt configuration these days? Everything about the drill so far is nice. The only flaw is the power switch on the front only operates the motor. If the unit is plugged in you must use two mini switches on the front to control the light and/or the laser. Optimally, a switch that controls total power to the unit downstream would have made the press complete. This will be added later.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Workman

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised with the higher quality of this unit!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat this drill press. I love the speed control lever. No need to switch belts. The digital RPM is also great. The laser is very helpful and aids in quick drilling. It can be a little hard to see when it's bright out but still works. I'm not sure how long it will last but you can buy two for the price of one more expensive unit so i'll take my chances.
customer_reviews.author: fj nick

customer_reviews.title: solid 4 star
customer_reviews.text: arrived today, kind of amazed that it only $200. set up was quick and simple,the thing is heavy which I take as a good thing. drilled a couple holes in some wood just to play around, plenty of power no run-out to speak of everything is square.the speed control is kinda cool not having to move belts and all but this one is kinda stuff time will tell. that's why I gave it 4 stars. time will tell. hopefully I remember to update this review after I put some hours in on the drill.
customer_reviews.author: adam nolte

customer_reviews.title: Solid mid size drill press with good features for the price
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little confusing at first but you can figure it out. Kind of installation and operations all in one manual. Seems pretty powerful for a little guy. Laser and lamp don't require batteries or a second plug, like in some cheaper tools, which is nice. Very solid feeling overall. motor stays set on rpms you choose even after turning off. Update: power is not as robust as a full sized production drill press but the motor is very resilient and reacts well and recovers quickly and consistently from overload. Very good transitions from different speeds. Still very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid well built tool
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how solid this drill press was. I was expecting much less for the price. It is made of well fitted machined metal parts. It was very easy to put together. Took about 20 minutes for a first timer. Only tool needed that was not included was an 8mm open ended wrench to tighten the handles. Lasers didn't even need adjusting, which, by the way, is clearly explained in manual on how to. I'll definitely be looking at WEN for any future tool needs. I have no idea on tech support as I have yet to need any.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Solid cast iron bench drill press. Great vaule. I’d rather have an 1,800 production device but. I’d also like to have the difference in price. I put this together in less than an hour. It was square and true out of the box. The laser cross hairs are true too. This runs smooth using an old standard variable belt drive and the speed read out seems true as there is a tach sensor on the drive side shaft. I looked at harbor freight and this has the quality hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Pterobyte

customer_reviews.title: Switch is broken
customer_reviews.text: The drill press is working great. Very easy to setup and align. I found a few plastic pieces when I unwrapped the head of the drill press I found that the bezel around the switch was broken. Leaving my review as 3 stars to see how this is taken care of. Also, for the money paid I am very pleased. The table top is not flat. So if you are looking for no light under your straight edge on the table right out of the box, this is not your unit.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon RB

customer_reviews.title: One of the best machines I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I wish I had gotten one sooner. It has come in handy on 10 projects just in the past 3 weeks. Powerful, easy to assemble and use and it feels build like a tank. Love the fact that I don't have to get into the top to change the speed of the drills. I have recommended this to a couple friends already. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clarky

customer_reviews.title: nice hobby drill press
customer_reviews.text: Just got it this morning. Yesterday I returned the same drill I ordered from Home Depot because it was damaged in the box. Amazon delivery was quick and with no problems. Assembled-it took about 1/2 hour. Looks like the chuck is a bit out of round, but I mainly do woodworking, so it's not a problem for me. Other than that the drill looks very good.
customer_reviews.author: Livia Bota

customer_reviews.title: Better shipping needed
customer_reviews.text: Was very eager to finally get to use a new drill press. Even went all out and spring to get the better tier out of the offerings WEN had. Right away box comes shipped in a cardboard box that being the only outer layer of protection from the elements. The styrofoam inside looks pretty good as far as protection goes. But yet I still have a large hole on the drill press. Very terrible feeling, was hoping to use this for weekend projects.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is good for the money. The handles are cheap and come loose. The switch is made from cheap plastic. The iron base is light weight and looks fragile. The chrome is already peeling off the parts that I thought were steel but now see are cheap slag metal. I can't imagine the digital readout will last too long. But for around $200, I got a 12" variable speed bench top drill press with decent power. If I was going to use it a lot, or if I didn't have a wife who monitored my spending, I would have gotten a JET or RIKON brand drill press in the $400-$600 range.
customer_reviews.author: NewMidwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Great value from WEN
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the purchase. Great for any hobby wood worker. Powerful, big and the bench is nice. Everything arrived in good shape and it went together super easy. Feels heavy duty and definitely has some good weight to it. Bigger than I expected. accurate and easy to use. Chuck works great. Nice straight drills.
customer_reviews.author: Marc colucci

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill press for the price
customer_reviews.text: The drill press is awesome but there was more shipping grease on the outside, then grease on moving parts. The Table was fine until I tried to tilt it. Had to use a mallet, oil and brute strength to remove it. Had no grease in it, but it works great. The press part was not greased either! So, it was easy to assemble, but be ready to spend some time on this guy, it has been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pennagirl

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty well designed drill press. However, the machining of operational gears and like components are not refined. They get the job done but there is a difference between this lower cost unit versus a higher cost unit from Jet or like company. For the money - it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill....  great for a hobbyist like me...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my purposes. I don't need a drill for a lot of heavy drilling... just for some hobbies like knife making and wood working, and this one is perfect for everything I have used it for so far. Plenty of power to drill right through metal, and precise enough for delicate wood working. It doesn't eat up a bunch of space in my garage either..
customer_reviews.author: Kvloeff in TX

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Ran it through entire range of speeds and it's fine. A little noisy, but barely. It's not a $5000 JET press, so I'm not expecting that performance. However, for its price, it's great so far. Accuracy out of the box is 0.003" runout. Laser was off about 0.04", but easily adjusted. Plenty strong. Did some semi-concealed cabinet door hinges in oak, and even tried on steel at low speed and worked fine (0.188" mild steel plate) and aluminum. I'll update after using it for a few months. BTW, bought it for home use, but I do a lot of remodeling and some fab work.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift!
customer_reviews.text: My dads Christmas gift, he's always wanted one so I got him one. Of course there was an alternative motive lol, we both use it a lot. Assembly was a breeze, we actually assembled it in the living room when he opened it then took it apart and put it back together in the garage. It is heavy once fully assembled so if you're going to place it on something make sure its absolutely stable and can carry weight.
customer_reviews.author: JTF

customer_reviews.title: Press Came Damaged
customer_reviews.text: The press came in today. The box was not taped well. A plastic cover on the press was broken and the top of the press had a dent in it. I am going to reconsider buying tools this way.I don't think the juice is worth the squeeze.The drill seems to function after I set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great little drill press
customer_reviews.text: I was just as skeptical as many others about this drill press. I almost bought the Jet, but went ahead and tried this one due to all the great reviews. Most of my shop is powermatic. I no longer needed my huge powermatic drill press and wanted something smaller. No, it's not the top of the line, but it suites my needs very well. Runs great and has enough power to drill through 1/4“ steel and 1 1/2× forsner bits in Maple.
customer_reviews.author: David A Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: I am an entry-level DYIer, slowly acquiring the tools needed for different projects. I already had a table-saw, miter saw, router and various other hand power tools. This is a great addition to my makeshift shop. Shipping was quick. Set up easy. And so far the drill works flawlessly - quiet, accurate, easy to handle, versatile and effective. I have much to discover about its full capacity, having used it only on various thicknesses of mostly soft wood. Looking forward to unlocking the possibilities. I'm thinking a band saw or belt sander will be next.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This drill press works really well!!! While I was very hesitant to make this purchase, in the end it was a great buy For me. It’s not as loud as other machines, but safety is always paramount!!! The only down fall is the rpm gauge not working, but I used it without any issues!
customer_reviews.author: F. A. USA

customer_reviews.title: It rust like crazy
customer_reviews.text: It is in my dry garage, and the post, chuck and a few other things have rusted just from the air. Nothing else in my garage has ever rusted like that. They don't have rust resistant alloys figured out yet. The drill is a little under powered for it's size, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home hobbyist.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying a drill press. Was very impressed with the WEN. The reviews and videos gave it a great rating for the money. It was easy to put together. Had it up and running in less than 20 minutes. The only thing that I found wrong was the laser was off a bit, but I doubt I ever use it so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: David Rohman

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a bench top drill press
customer_reviews.text: I got this drill press for a song just by keeping an eye on the price. Works great for a bench top drill press, and went together quickly. the laser and speed readout stopped working after 2 uses. I'm assuming its just a loose wire or something and I'll be able to fix it myself but kind of annoying to have to troubleshoot a brand new machine. I use it for woodworking so it does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press for the price
customer_reviews.text: It has a slight visible wobble to the chuck head, hit it a few times with a rubber mallet thinking it wasn't seated well enough but to no avail. It drills a hole so boom. Beware that it won't drill a very big hole though. Stalled out drilling a 1 1/8" hole in wood, with a light touch it finished the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Drizzt

customer_reviews.title: BEST DRILL PRESS
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR A GOOD DRILL PRESS. SINCE I AM A HOBBYIST. IT WAS THE BEST FOR THE MONEY. IT HAS LASER X THAT MARKS THE SPOT. A WORK LIGHT AND IT TELLS YOU THE RPM'S DIGITALLY. TABLE CAN BE ROTATED TO 45 DEG. CAN BE RAISED AND LOWERED. iT HAS MORE SPINDLE MOVEMENT DOWN THAT OTHER DP'S. VERY ACCURATE AND EASY TO USE. FOR THE MONEY I THINK THIS IS THE BEST I COULD GET.
customer_reviews.author: ED G.

customer_reviews.title: I didn't expect this kind of quality for $250.  I'll put it against ANY $500 press any day!  Great job Wen!!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this kind of quality for $250. I thought I was buying a cheap (inexpensive) short-term drill press and that I'd ultimately upgrade one day. This is an AMAZING drill press. Better than any standalone or desktop's I've used before (I'm no expert, but I've probably used 10 different drill presses before). It was relatively easy assembling this press, but I think they want you to assembly it so you can feel the quality of each piece as you put it together. This is a TANK and I love it - so do my friends! I continue to be impressed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Chuck or spindle bent
customer_reviews.text: All of my bits do the same thing and I have re-seated everything multiple times. End of ALL drill bits wobble so very difficult to get a hole centered, actually size or started. Too much of a pain to ship back so I will just use for wood projects.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably sturdy for the price range. I do have concerns about the loss of bel;t traction on harder woods, but slowing down solved that issue. Well worth the money IMHO. Note: I have seen videos of this model where the laser and lamp were battery operated. This model has the power connected to them instead. Great change to the item.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: Granted this is a benchtop drillpress, still, it goes from full speed to a dead stop when using a 1.5" forstner bit on walnut in under 2 seconds. Also the way the chuck is installed, it tends to be unstable and even more so at low speeds.The laser and light on it a really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and good price for a 12" drill press. One con however. The gear to raise and lower the table was broken at the factory. Someone forced it and broke two of the teeth and still put it in the box to ship. Called Wen and they sent a replacement gear.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you are on the fence
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, For a product made in China i don't think you could get any higher quality. was able to drill a 5mm hole about 2-1/2inches deep. My only complaint is the "table extender" gets in the way when you are trying to use clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Q.

customer_reviews.title: This is a decent drill press.  for the money, its a great deal.  its not garbage.  It's not perfect, but its not garbage either.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent cheap drill press. there is a little runout... but not much. the laser guide is great. It is belt drive so no broken gears to worry about, the table is nice. workmanship is decent for something cheap... Its well worth the money. I would definitely buy it again, The next step up from here is something brand name, and much more money...
customer_reviews.author: JL Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: It's not commercial quality, bit it's closer to it than I expected. Solidly built and smooth operation. The manual provides details on how to adjust it of needed. Best quality I've seen from China. My only complaint is that the readout does not automatically power down, so it must be unplugged if you want to turn it off. In case the safety nazis complain that you should unplug it anyway, be aware that it does have a removable "key" to prevent accidental/unauthorized operation.
customer_reviews.author: Mango

customer_reviews.title: WEN customer support, best yet!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 4214 in 2015, the earlier yellow model. I've put it through more than it should and it's kept going. I finally managed to cause some damage, by no fault from the manufacturer. Called WEN customer support and they really went the extra mile to find a replacement part that would work for my older model, going as far as to send pictures for comparison while still on the phone to make sure it was right. Awesome job Paul!
customer_reviews.author: Chad E Cushman

customer_reviews.title: Tons of runout. To the point it limits its use.
customer_reviews.text: Its a very weak machine that's only about adequate, but also the amount of runout in the spindle is pretty bad. I have to limit the length of the drill bit because a longer one really exacerbates the runout. We are talking .020"+
customer_reviews.author: OC_

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it stinks (smells bad)
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I put a dial test indicator on it and it only had 2 thou of runout.... that's pretty good for the price. The only complaint is it smells like Harbor Freight... that smell you know. Anyway I would buy it again because it works very well, love the light and the speed adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G Parks

customer_reviews.title: Finally got my drill press.
customer_reviews.text: Great little drill press for my workshop. Seems to be well made and runs smoothly. Glad I got this size and not the smaller one because anything smaller would not have been suitable for me. It is well made and I like the features, and it came at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Egger

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features  for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using this drill press for a couple of weeks. Assembly was straight forward. Accuracy is acceptable... and lazer came accurate. Runnout may not be perfect, but expect this to smooth out with some use. Certainly acceptable for DIY woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Milt Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly heavy-duty drill. Speed doesn't go below 600 or so (at least I couldn't get it any lower) so it is tough to use on harder metals with large bits. Belt slipped a little bit, but I was using a 1.5 inch hole saw on 1/8 inch aluminum plate. Overall good quality (WAY heavier than I expected!) at a pretty good price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Laser dont work and chuck keeps falling out
customer_reviews.text: The drill press was delivered in a beat up box. One of the lasers dont work and the when using it the chuck keeps on falling out. The item is pretty heavy and with a bad knee i didn't want to hassle with getting a new box, taking it apart, repackaging it and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price, Larger motor would make it perfect..
customer_reviews.text: Hesitant to recommend a wen product because of past experience with cheap tools. Forget about what i just said, have had this 12" press for some months use it a lot. It is one tough mean machine, very stocky and near as i can tell right on the money with no noticeable run out. Speed adjustment great. My one complaint, it could use more power, i can stall it. But to tell the truth at this price if i had to buy a larger motor I still think it was a good deal. No i do not work for wen. Really do think this machine would compare favorably with more expensive machines.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fleischman

customer_reviews.title: Like It
customer_reviews.text: Received this on time with the 2 day shipping. Was pretty easy to put together. The table has an extension slide on one side, WEN should consider adding an extension on both sides. Very pleased with this so far, haven't used it a lot but what little I have it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: If you want more than a toy look for a better made tool
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing a floor model highschool drill press from the 50's maybe, maybe older. This is cheaply manufactured by comparison as you would expect. There is no lock to hold the chuck down in position. The depth gage is difficult to use and loosens by itself. The head, motor, belts and chuck, is all held in place with a single undersized allen screw. Impossible to tighten enough to prevent head rotation. The head tube has some wobble where it attaches to the foot. If you want more than a toy look for a better made tool.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kitchell

product_meta.title: WEN 4214 12-Inch Variable Speed Drill Press,Orange
product_meta.description: Remember when power tools were actually powerful? WEN’s 12-inch swing, variable speed drill press with laser centering device, is a powerhouse for your shop. Packed with features that you’ll find in larger more industrial type drill presses. This bench-top, cast iron drill press has the power to drill through metal, wood and other materials. Max drill capacity is 5/8” in 1” thick cast iron. The variable speed feature allows you to target in the exact speed (infinitely from 580-3200 RPM) that works for your project. While you are working you simply move a lever and adjust the speed as needed. No pulleys and belts to change! Our design uses a mechanical variable speed which allows for the same power and torque through the entire speed range. A digital readout powered by LED’s displays the running speed. Constructed with a rigid frame consisting of cast iron: head, table, and base, ensures accurate holes. Its powerful induction motor features ball bearings for an extended life and it all comes together with smooth and balanced performance even at high speeds. The 5/8” chuck with MT2 spindle taper gives you versatility with a variety of bits and features on-board chuck key storage, so you never have to hunt around for it. Worktable bevels 45° left and right for those tricky operations for the perfect right angles consistently. Base has predrilled holes for mounting onto a bench or work stand. Slotted table allows for mounting clamps and vises for effective mounting. The X-pattern laser locks-on to your drill points saving on guesswork and sparing expensive materials. A versatile and valuable tool for any shop especially when you expand its range of use with optional accessories such as mortising attachments, drum sanders, circle cutters, etc. Since 1951, WEN has proudly produced innovative powered tools focused on value delivering meaningful features that will help you complete and enjoy the work as much as the project. Remember when you could drill with laser precision? Remember WEN. DO NOT use power tools in the presence of flammable liquids or gases. Drill press Base -10 x 16 inches
feature_bullets: Infinitely variable speed ranges from 580-3200 RPMS. Mechanical variable speed delivers equal torque throughout the range. LED read out displays speed.
Spindle Travel of 3-1/8" with easy to read, locking linear depth stop for accurate and repeatable drilling operations. Front to the back of the motor is 22 inches
Quill diameter of 2.17 inches. Durable 2/3hp induction motor develops ample torque and power. Motor: 120 V, 60 Hz. Laser Module: Class III
9-1/2 x 9-1/2" cast iron worktable features rack & pinion height adjustment and bevels up to 45 Degree left & right. Width with the handles: 14-1/2"
Includes drill press, mechanical variable speed, laser, table roller extension, 5/8" keyed chuck & key, tools for assembly.Drill press Height from the Floor to the top: 37 inch
